org.lasarobotics.vision.android

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lasarobotics.vision.android.Camera

  • public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements a single Android camera Used to get information about an Android native camera, as well as perform a few critical functions

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Camera(Cameras camera)
      Instantiate an instance of a camera WARNING! Each camera can only be instantiated in once place at a time - be sure to release() when you are done.

    • Method Summary

      • Camera

        public Camera(Cameras camera)
        Instantiate an instance of a camera WARNING! Each camera can only be instantiated in once place at a time - be sure to release() when you are done.

    • Method Detail

      • doesExist

        public boolean doesExist()
        Tests whether the camera exists (i.e. is not null)
        Returns:
        True if camera is not null, false otherwise

      • getAllFrameSizes

        public java.util.List<org.opencv.core.Size> getAllFrameSizes()
        Get all frame sizes supported by the camera
        Returns:
        A list of supported frame sizes

      • getBestFrameSize

        public org.opencv.core.Size getBestFrameSize()
        Get the best frame size for real-time video
        Returns:
        Best frame size, generally significantly smaller than the largest frame size

      • getCamera

        public android.hardware.Camera getCamera()
        Get an instance of a camera
        Returns:
        The native camera instance

      • getCameraCount

        public static int getCameraCount()
        Get the number of cameras available
        Returns:
        Number of native cameras

      • getID

        public int getID()
        Get the internal ID of the camera
        Returns:
        The camera's ID

      • getLargestFrameSize

        public org.opencv.core.Size getLargestFrameSize()
        Get the largest frame size supported by the camera
        Returns:
        Largest frame size in pixels

      • isHardwareAvailable

        public static boolean isHardwareAvailable()
        Checks if the hardware supports a camera. It should.
        Returns:
        True if hardware supports camera, false otherwise

      • lock

        public void lock()
        Lock the camera so the current application can use it - be sure to unlock()

      • release

        public void release()
        Unlock and release the camera instance. After calling this method, destory the Camera instance and recreate it if you need to use it again

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
        Unlock the camera for use by other applications
